intro: Stiftia elegans, commonly known as the elegant stiftia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and open woodlands. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are typically yellow or orange in color. Stiftia elegans is known for its resilience to drought and its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
